instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: 820 - 00426 liquid damage
threads.message:
Hey guys!

Just a quick one here. 

I have a 820 - 00426 that has some coffee split on it, considering - it looks great!

I have a short on <SIGNAL>PPVIN_S5_HS_COMPUTING_INSN</SIGNAL>

Clear liquid damage on <CHIP>U7320</CHIP>. 

My question is because this supplies power to the CPU, would this board be toast, I have to wait to get a replacement IC in, no doners and non in stock! Just curious :) 

Thanks.

threads.title: 820 - 00426 liquid damage
threads.message:
I bet CPU is fried now.
Remove <CHIP>U7320</CHIP> and check if short gone from <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.

BTW, forget about donor board, when you search FDMF6808N.
We already explained the reason and why need to buy new FDMF6708/3030.

threads.title: 820 - 00426 liquid damage
threads.message:
Thanks for the input! 

I removed <CHIP>U7320</CHIP> and short is gone, green light on DCIN jack and fanspin. 

Does this mean I go get a lotto ticket?
